Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Keeps in an inactive conformation TGFBR1, the TGF-beta type I serine/threonine kinase receptor, preventing TGF-beta receptor activation in absence of ligand. Recruites SMAD7 to ACVR1B which prevents the association of SMAD2 and SMAD3 with the activin receptor complex, thereby blocking the activin signal. May modulate the RYR1 calcium channel activity. PPIases accelerate the folding of proteins. It catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of proline imidic peptide bonds in oligopeptides.

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a type I transforming growth factor beta receptor.
Funtion.Keyword: Type I transforming growth factor beta receptor binding

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with activin, a dimer of inhibin-beta subunits.
Catalysis of the geometric or structural changes within one molecule. Isomerase is the systematic name for any enzyme of EC class 5.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with the transforming growth factor beta receptor.
Funtion.Keyword: Transforming growth factor beta receptor binding

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a macrolide, any of a large group of structurally related antibiotics produced by Streptomyces species.
Conveys a signal across a cell to trigger a change in cell function or state. A signal is a physical entity or change in state that is used to transfer information in order to trigger a response.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with the immunosuppressant FK506.
Catalysis of the reaction: peptidyl-proline (omega=180) = peptidyl-proline (omega=0).
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a SMAD signaling protein.

Interacting selectively and non-covalently with one or more specific sites on an ion channel, a protein complex that spans a membrane and forms a water-filled channel across the phospholipid bilayer allowing selective ion transport down its electrochemical gradient.

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of an I-kappaB kinase/NF-kappaB induced cascade.
BioProcess.Keyword: Positive regulation of I-kappaB kinase/NF-kappaB cascade

BioProcess.Detail: A process that is carried out at the cellular level which results in the assembly, arrangement of constituent parts, or disassembly of fibrils, extracellular matrix material consisting of polysaccharides and protein.
The process in which calcium ions sequestered in the endoplasmic reticulum or mitochondria are released into the cytosolic compartment.
BioProcess.Keyword: Release of sequestered calcium ion into cytosol

BioProcess.Detail: The series of molecular signals generated as a consequence of a transforming growth factor beta receptor binding to one of its physiological ligands.
BioProcess.Keyword: Transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway

BioProcess.Detail: The process of assisting in the folding of a nascent peptide chain into its correct tertiary structure.
A process in which a calcium ion is transported from one side of a membrane to the other by means of some agent such as a transporter or pore.
The developmental process in which the heart is generated and organized. The heart is a hollow, muscular organ, which, by contracting rhythmically, keeps up the circulation of the blood.
The process of assisting in the covalent and noncovalent assembly of single chain polypeptides or multisubunit complexes into the correct tertiary structure.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the immune response, the immunological reaction of an organism to an immunogenic stimulus.
Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of protein binding.
Any process that stops, prevents or reduces the rate of addition of phosphate groups to amino acids within a protein.
The expansion of a T cell population by cell division. Follows T cell activation.

The process of assisting in the covalent and noncovalent assembly of single chain polypeptides or multisubunit complexes into the correct tertiary structure that results in the attainment of the full functional capacity of a protein.

The process of inhibiting aggregation and assisting in the covalent and noncovalent assembly of single chain polypeptides or multisubunit complexes into the correct tertiary structure that is dependent on interaction with a chaperone.
The process of creating a trabecula in the heart. A trabecula is a tissue element in the form of a small beam, strut or rod.
The process in which the anatomical structures of cardiac ventricle muscle is generated and organized.
The change in morphology and behavior of a mature or immature T cell resulting from exposure to a mitogen, cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or an antigen for which it is specific.
The process carried out by a cell that restores the biological activity of an unfolded or misfolded protein, using helper proteins such as chaperones.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of any process in which a protein is transported to, or maintained in, a specific location.
The modification of a protein by cis-trans isomerization of a proline residue.
Any process that stops or reduces the activity of the enzyme protein phosphatase type 2B.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of protein phosphatase type 2B activity

BioProcess.Detail: A process in which force is generated within muscle tissue, resulting in a change in muscle geometry. Force generation involves a chemo-mechanical energy conversion step that is carried out by the actin/myosin complex activity, which generates force through ATP hydrolysis.
Any series of molecular signals generated as a consequence of a cytokine or chemokine binding to a cell surface receptor.

A change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a caffeine stimulus. Caffeine is an alkaloid found in numerous plant species, where it acts as a natural pesticide that paralyzes and kills certain insects feeding upon them.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the activity of any activin receptor signaling pathway.
BioProcess.Keyword: Regulation of activin receptor signaling pathway

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that modulates the activity of a ryanodine-sensitive calcium-release channel. The ryanodine-sensitive calcium-release channel catalyzes the transmembrane transfer of a calcium ion by a channel that opens when a ryanodine class ligand has been bound by the channel complex or one of its constituent parts.
BioProcess.Keyword: Regulation of ryanodine-sensitive calcium-release channel activity

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of the addition of ubiquitin groups to a protein.
A change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of an iron ion stimulus.
The aggregation, arrangement and bonding together of a set of components to form a protein complex that contains SMAD proteins.
